lead_paragraph: MANDA--Edythe Evin. Of Syosset, NY died March 23, 2016. She was born in Manhattan on August 17, 1930, the daughter of H. Robert and Pearl Levine. She grew up in Brooklyn, NY, and was educated at Erasmus Hall High School, where she was editor of its newspaper, The Dutchman. She studied English at Brooklyn College, and Masters Degree programs at Columbia University and Long Island University. She also studied at the Sorbonne University in Paris, France. She resided in Paris, France; Brooklyn; Manhattan, including Greenwich Village, and the Upper West Side; Queens and Syosset, NY. She was married to Robert F. Manda, and had one cherished daughter, Roberta, to whom she was selflessly devoted for more than 51 years. She was further devoted to her 35 year career as a high school English and Reading teacher, guidance counselor and college bound coordinator at George Wingate High School in Brooklyn, NY. She additionally taught English at New York City High Schools: High School of the Performing Arts, Tilden High School, Martin Van Buren High School and Charles Evan Hughes High School. She was also a talented and creative poet and author. She further dedicated the last almost 24 years of her life to her cherished and devoted grandchildren, Kevin and Caroline. She made the world a better place and left a lasting continuing legacy of her committed ideals of love, loyalty, justice, equality and compassion. She and her bright eyes and beautiful smile will be missed by all who knew her. She is survived by her daughter, Roberta Manda-Flan- nery, an attorney and New York State Administrative Law Judge; her grandson, Kevin Flannery, a dental student at New York University College of Dentistry; her granddaughter, Caroline Flannery, a college student at Towson University, her son- in-law, David Flannery; her brother, Arthur B. Levine; nieces, nephews, great-nieces, great-nephew, and cousins. 1/3
